summary: A standalone mod that will change the appearances of female NPCs (except Orcs and beasts) at Bards College, Blue Palace, Morthal, Stonehills, Dawnstar, Riverwood, Whiterun and it's outlying farms. Currently a WIP as I am aiming to improve NPC appearance as well as including Old People Race, and reduce occurances of Dark face bugs.
descriptionHtml:
[center][size=5][color=#ff0000][b][u]NOTICE[/u]:[/b] [/color][b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/80479/?]Dames of Skyrim Complete/Legendary[/url][/b] has been uploaded and available.[/size]


[b][img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/71778-0-1449373542.png[/img][/b]

[b][color=#ff0000][size=6][b][u]FOREWORD[/u][/b][/size][/color][/b]

[size=3]This is still a [/size][b]Work-In-Progress[/b][size=3] version so not all the females are modded. Updates and notices will be posted soon.[/size]
[size=3]The good part about this mod is that it doesn't pose any trouble when updating as opposed to followers/companions[/size]
[size=3]which requires to be dismissed before any update. This is not a lore-friendly mod (does everything have to be since[/size]
[size=3]there is no page I can find that their hair needs to be in some specific style). The only intention of this mod is[/size]
[size=3]to change female NPC appearance and nothing more. I mean, c'mon, who doesn't want to make their Skyrim sexy?
Thank goodness [/size][size=3]that Skyrim's a single player game (which some... ...some?... ...no, [b][color=#ff0000]A LOT OF FOLKS[/color][/b] have failed to
comprehend). If you feel that this mod is not [/size][size=3]lore-friendly to your game nor it to be your cup of tea, save yourself
the trouble and [b][color=#ff0000]DO NOT INSTALL[/color][/b] this mod. Mod creators make their mods [/size][size=3]as how they are personally envisioned.
[b]PERSONALLY![/b] I will not charge money for this mod. All mods used to create this mod is/was put together from
other mods [/size][size=3]created by respective mod creators mentioned in the description's credits and in no way do I own them.
All mods and tools that have been used to create this mod is intended to change female NPC appearances only as[/size]
[size=3]mentioned, as well as I have envisioned. No dope was used. Unless you consider caffeine as "dope".
[/size]

[img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/72563-1-1452419965.jpg[/img]


[color=#ff0000][size=6][b][u]DESCRIPTION[/u][/b][/size]
[/color]
[size=3]A standalone mod that will change the appearances of female NPCs (except for Orcs and beasts) at Bards College,
Blue Palace, Morthal, Stonehills, Dawnstar, Riverwood, Whiterun and it's outlying farms. Currently a WIP as I'm
aiming to improve NPC appearance as well as including Old People Race (eventually), and reduce occurrences of
the dreaded Dark face bugs.
[/size]
[color=#ff0000][size=6][b][u]DAMES OF SKYRIM SERIES 3 Background[/u][/b][/size][/color]

[size=3]To simplify, this is a continuation of both [/size][b][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/71778/?]Dames of [/url][/size][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/71778/?][size=3]Skyrim Series 1[/size][/url][/b][size=3] and [b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/72168/?]Dames of Skyrim Series 2[/url][/b] which were
[/size][size=3]perviously released in the month of December 2015. My intention for this mod is to change appearances of most
female NPCs (excluding Orcs, [/size][size=3]Argonians, and Khajiits) as I used to see them with generic faces and their[/size]
[size=3]extended chins - which some people still insist that they look fine.
[/size]

[img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/72563-2-1452426700.jpg[/img]
[color=#b6b6b6][size=2]You look fine, Saadia. And I know it's hot in the kitchen which is why you sweat.[/size][/color]


[size=3]WELL NOT FOR ME!!! This is why I created [/size][size=3]this mod. I'm pretty sure some folks will agree with me that one NPC[/size]
[size=3]even has the same hairdo as the next one. Should I name a few? NAH! You can see it in your game as I've seen it[/size]
[size=3]on mine when I first played this game a couple of years ago.
[/size]

[img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/72563-0-1452426700.jpg[/img]
[color=#b6b6b6]You look beautiful, Adrianne. Too bad you're already married.[/color]
[size=3]
Work's basically inspired by creator of [/size][b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/40038/?]Bijin Warmaidens[/url][/b][size=3] and [/size][b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/63473/?]Bijin Wives[/url][/b][size=3] by [/size][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/2650523/?][b]rxkx22[/b][/url][size=3] (thanks for making the game look[/size]
[size=3]and feel much better). The work done put in is extremely beautiful that I intentionally dodged modding those NPCs.
[/size][size=3]As well as [/size][b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59269/?]KS Hairdos Female NPC Overhaul[/url] [/b][size=3]by [/size][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/1975658/?][b]frostsmith[/b][/url][size=3] which has the longest duration in my mods list (thanks for[/size]
[size=3]sharing). The work they put in has undeniably made better looking NPCs far from the original vanilla look. But as
mentioned in my other two previous mods, I'm still scratching the very same[/size][size=3] itch to push this project forward so I
took the time to actually understand how to [/size][size=3]create/mod NPCs without changing any (as much as possible) of the
default assets already done by [/size][b][url=http://bethsoft.com/]Bethesda[/url][/b][size=3].[/size]

[size=3]Yes, nothing has been changed except for clothing on some NPCs as well as Races. But their [/size][i]npcweight[/i][size=3] such[/size]
[size=3]as Carlotta Valentia in Whiterun is still zero. ZIP. None. Nada.
[/size]

[img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/72563-19-1452419963.jpg[/img]
[color=#b6b6b6][size=2]Sorry, Carlotta. I don't have the heart to change your npcweight. But I did give you a lovely makeover.[/size][/color]
[size=3]
Again, not all the female NPCs have been edited/modded as this time since it's still a Work In Progress. I was
having trouble with the Old People Race. I have a few forced into the Nord race based on relationship of
another NPC such as Idgrod Ravencrone (originally Elder Race) with Idgrod the Younger, as well as Inge Six
Fingers and Illdi (favorite student). But just like any other mods, this will progress into [/size][size=3]eventually on the[/size]
[size=3]next rotation when it's available. I have used other mods for the Elder Race but have come up unsuccessful.[/size]
[size=3]Neck seams and discoloration. As for now, mods on the other females in Series 1 and 2 needs to be updated.
[/size]

[img]http://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/72563-1-1452426700.jpg[/img]
[color=#b6b6b6][size=2]No. I don't have Ataxia nor the Rattles. Do u have a Daedric Heart in your inventory?[/size][/color]


[u]VIDEO:
[/u][size=3]Thanks to [b][url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCwrbrD717or75H4I5enK-eg]PixelGamer[/url][/b] for featuring my mod in his YouTube channel.

[youtube]VqToabcpnV4[/youtube][/size][/center][center]

[b][color=#ff0000][size=6][u]REQUIREMENTS[/u]:[/size][/color][/b]

[size=3]Skyrim version 1.9
[b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/2666/?]Caliente's Beautiful Bodies Edition by Caliente
 [b][/b][/url][b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/6709/?]DIMONIZED UNP female body by dimon99[/url][/b][/b][/size][b]

[/b]
[b][color=#ff0000][size=6][u]INSTALLATION[/u]:[/size][/color][/b]

[size=3]Install with either Nexusmods Manager or Mod Organizer.


[b][color=#ff0000][size=6][u]FAQs[/u]:[/size][/color][/b]

[size=3]Q: I installed CBBE. Do I need to install the UNP version too?
[/size]A: No. You install CBBE version for CBBE. UNP version for UNP.

[size=3]Q: I have SeveNBase in my game. How can I make use of the UNP version?
[/size]A: Copy the following files from your "\Program Files (x86)\Steam\SteamApps\common\Skyrim\Data\meshes\actors\character\character assets"

1stpersonfemalehands_0.nif
1stpersonfemalehands_1.nif
femalebody_0.nif
femalebody_1.nif
femalefeet_0.nif
femalefeet_1.nif
femalehands_0.nif
femalehands_1.nif

to "\Program Files (x86)\Steam\SteamApps\common\Skyrim\Data\meshes\avatar3s\SKW_WhiteMortSol\Common".
Basically, the UVW mapping of UNP, UNPB, and SeveNBase share the same UV layout.

Q: Can I get these in individual installation?
A: No. You're just making things difficult.

Q: Home come the eyes are red? Sometimes they're blue.
A: That's usually ENB causing it when NPC is outdoors. Put them indoors and their eyes are normal.

Q: Are the NPCs wearing the same set of clothes you have in your game?
A: No. When they were put together in Creation Kit, I specified default. Whatever
clothing mod you have, it applies to that. In my case, it's Little Sexy Apparel Replacer.

Q: How come you mentioned HDT when the ones you uploaded don't have HDT.
A: Too much HDT all over the game makes the NPCs disappear OR not render at all.

Q: Are you going to combine them into one giant mod?
A: No. I haven't merged any of my mods because I like to keep them loose. Easier
for me to make things personalized or customized to my preference.

Q: When are you planning to release Series 1 and 2 complete?
A: Soon. Very soon. I know I pumped 44 NPCs in 2 weeks. But I still have a life outside Skyrim.

Q: So why do you have Tinkerbell look-alike on your mod?
A. Don't know. Did that by accident. Do you want me to put Elsa in here too? Let it go.
[/size][b][color=#ff0000][size=6]
[u]UNINSTALL[/u]:[/size][/color][/b]

[size=3]Uninstall whichever mod manager you are using, be it Nexusmods Manager or Mod Organizer.[/size]

[/size][/url][/b][/center][center][b][color=#ff0000][size=6]SPECIAL THANKS:[/size][/color]

- To [b][/b][b][color=#1e84cc]Yulia Leontiev Shmaratov[/color][/b] for allowing me to use her facial features for NPC Olfina Grey-Mane.
Thank you so much for giving me the opportunity.[/size]
